DataElement.preferredName: Normal Adjacent Tissue Biospecimen Pre-analytical Variables Program Standard Operating Procedure Process Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates whether the normal adjacent tissue biospecimens were processed according to the requirements of the BPV standard operating procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Normal Adjacent Tissue Biospecimen Pre-analytical Variables Program Standard Operating Procedure Process
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm._Next to or adjoining._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens._An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation._A sequence of events which produces some outcome.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.:Next to or adjoining.:An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.:Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredName: Biospecimen Pre-analytical Variables Program Standard Operating Procedure Process
Property.preferredDefinition: A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens.:An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation.:A sequence of events which produces some outcome.

Concepts.definition: A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens.
An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation.
A sequence of events which produces some outcome.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
